title: Topic 001 Question 142
body: Your company has workloads running on Compute Engine and on-premises. The Google Cloud Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is connected to your WAN over a
Virtual Private Network (VPN). You need to deploy a new Compute Engine instance and ensure that no public Internet traffic can be routed to it. What should you do?
options: Create the instance without a public IP address.
Create the instance with Private Google Access enabled.
Create a deny-all egress firewall rule on the VPC network.
Create a route on the VPC to route all traffic to the instance over the VPN tunnel.
